step_by_step.explanation: Unemployment occurs when people who are willing and able to work cannot find jobs.

problems.final_answer: Unemployment is when people willing and able to work cannot find employment.

step_by_step.explanation: Frictional, structural, cyclical, and seasonal unemployment are common types.
Frictional unemployment occurs when workers are temporarily between jobs or searching for new jobs.

problems.final_answer: Frictional unemployment: temporary unemployment while searching for jobs.

step_by_step.explanation: Structural unemployment occurs due to a mismatch between workersâ€™ skills and job requirements.

problems.final_answer: Structural unemployment: mismatch of skills and job requirements.

step_by_step.explanation: Cyclical unemployment results from downturns in the business cycle when demand for goods and services falls.

problems.final_answer: Cyclical unemployment: caused by economic downturns and reduced demand.

step_by_step.explanation: Seasonal unemployment occurs when workers are unemployed at certain times of the year due to the nature of their jobs.

problems.final_answer: Seasonal unemployment: unemployment at specific times due to seasonal work.

step_by_step.explanation: Inflation is the sustained increase in the general price level of goods and services in an economy over a period.

problems.final_answer: Inflation: sustained rise in general price level of goods/services.

step_by_step.explanation: Demand-pull inflation and cost-push inflation are the main types.
Occurs when aggregate demand exceeds aggregate supply, pushing prices up.

problems.final_answer: Demand-pull inflation: prices rise due to excess aggregate demand over supply.

step_by_step.explanation: Occurs when production costs increase (e.g., wages, raw materials), causing firms to raise prices.

problems.final_answer: Cost-push inflation: prices rise due to higher production costs.
